Issue Description:
 
The MenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Health June issue celebrates inspiring weight loss stories. Four men, four different cities, but one common goalÃ¢â‚¬â€to shed fat and make way for a better life. In Focus are 30-year-old Lalit Bisht, a call centre executive turned fashion model from New Delhi, Tharun Sholarajan, a 31-year-old business man from Bengaluru, a 40-year-old investment banker, Saurabh G from Singapore and MumbaiÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Gaurav Arora, a 23-year old entrepreneur. Hectic schedules and erratic work hours didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t stop them from turning around their obese torsos to chiseled hot bods. These four men talk of their journeys and share handy tips along the way that you can use too. Our panel of experts comprising MH fitness expert and columnist Deckline Leitao, celebrity nutrition coach Ryan Fernando and WomenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Health editor Sanghamitra Chakrabarty rates them on a scale of 1 to 10 and tell you how they could have done it better. The story proves a point that a chiseled core can give you more than the second glances, the female attention and the cocky swagger. A toned, healthy body shows that you are in control of your life, ambitions and dreams.
An Indian Summer
This season, give your traditional wardrobe a contemporary twist and add an edge to convention. Comedian turned actor Vir Das doles shows you how to beat the heat with light Indian fabrics.

Magazine Description:

Men's Health India is a lifestyle magazine that offers health, fitness, nutrition, sex, style and grooming advice to men. While there is an accent on fitness, it is more famous for it's 'how to' sections that answer questions most men have, but don't know who to ask. It is India's largest-selling men's magazine since its launch in 2006, and is the biggest men's magazine in the world
